message.content:
cs.DS, cs.CG, cs.DM, cs.LG, cs.NA. 

The paper deals with the simplex method, a well-known algorithm for linear programming, and its application to polyhedra with certain curvature properties. This suggests that the paper could belong to several sub-categories related to algorithms, optimization, and geometry. 

cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) is a likely category because the paper develops a new type of dual analysis for the shadow simplex method, which is a variant of the simplex method. 

cs.CG (Computational Geometry) is also a likely category because the paper studies polyhedra with discrete curvature properties, which are a type of geometric object. 

cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) is a possible category because the paper considers polyhedra with certain combinatorial properties, such as totally unimodular constraint matrices. 

cs.LG (Machine Learning) is a possible category because the paper uses techniques from optimization and geometry, which are relevant to some areas of machine learning. 

cs.NA (Numerical Analysis) is a possible category because the paper deals with the simplex method, which is a numerical algorithm, and provides bounds on the number of pivots required to solve linear programs.
